document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Science

C1F96710DFE701311BAD68A86D17958E.description: observe changes that are part of a simple life cycle of a plant: seed, seedling, plant, flower, and fruit.

C1F921F0DFE701311BAC68A86D17958E.description: identify ways that young plants resemble the parent plant; and

C1F8DC70DFE701311BAB68A86D17958E.description: identify parts of plants such as roots, stem, and leaves and parts of animals such as head, eyes, and limbs;

C1F894E0DFE701311BAA68A86D17958E.description: sort plants and animals into groups based on physical characteristics such as color, size, body covering, or leaf shape;

C1F83D20DFE701311BA968A86D17958E.description: Organisms and environments. The student knows that organisms resemble their parents and have structures and processes that help them survive within their environments. The student is expected to:

C20229A0DFE701311BCD68A86D17958E.description: examine evidence that living organisms have basic needs such as food, water, and shelter for animals and air, water, nutrients, sunlight, and space for plants.

C201EB40DFE701311BCC68A86D17958E.description: differentiate between living and nonliving things based upon whether they have basic needs and produce offspring; and

C201A940DFE701311BCB68A86D17958E.description: Organisms and environments. The student knows that plants and animals have basic needs and depend on the living and nonliving things around them for survival. The student is expected to:

C2016310DFE701311BCA68A86D17958E.description: observe, describe, and illustrate objects in the sky such as the clouds, Moon, and stars, including the Sun.

C2011550DFE701311BC968A86D17958E.description: identify events that have repeating patterns, including seasons of the year and day and night; and

C200D150DFE701311BC868A86D17958E.description: observe and describe weather changes from day to day and over seasons;

C2008E40DFE701311BC768A86D17958E.description: Earth and space. The student knows that there are recognizable patterns in the natural world and among objects in the sky. The student is expected to:

C2004D60DFE701311BC668A86D17958E.description: give examples of ways rocks, soil, and water are useful.

C2000860DFE701311BC568A86D17958E.description: observe and describe physical properties of natural sources of water, including color and clarity; and

C1FFA0F0DFE701311BC468A86D17958E.description: observe, describe, compare, and sort rocks by size, shape, color, and texture;

C1FF5FD0DFE701311BC368A86D17958E.description: Earth and space. The student knows that the natural world includes earth materials. The student is expected to:

C1FF1C70DFE701311BC268A86D17958E.description: observe and describe the ways that objects can move such as in a straight line, zigzag, up and down, back and forth, round and round, and fast and slow.

C1FEDD40DFE701311BC168A86D17958E.description: observe and describe the location of an object in relation to another such as above, below, behind, in front of, and beside; and

C1FE9B90DFE701311BC068A86D17958E.description: explore interactions between magnets and various materials;

C1FE51C0DFE701311BBF68A86D17958E.description: use the five senses to explore different forms of energy such as light, heat, and sound;

C1FDF750DFE701311BBE68A86D17958E.description: Force, motion, and energy. The student knows that energy, force, and motion are related and are a part of their everyday life. The student is expected to:

C1FDA9B0DFE701311BBD68A86D17958E.description: observe, record, and discuss how materials can be changed by heating or cooling.

C1FD6060DFE701311BBC68A86D17958E.description: observe and record properties of objects, including relative size and mass, such as bigger or smaller and heavier or lighter, shape, color, and texture; and

C1FD1AF0DFE701311BBB68A86D17958E.description: Matter and energy. The student knows that objects have properties and patterns. The student is expected to:

C1FCCE70DFE701311BBA68A86D17958E.description: use senses as a tool of observation to identify properties and patterns of organisms, objects, and events in the environment

C1FC8320DFE701311BB968A86D17958E.description: collect information using tools, including computers, hand lenses, primary balances, cups, bowls, magnets, collecting nets, and notebooks; timing devices, including clocks and timers; non-standard measuring items such as paper clips and clothespins; weather instruments such as demonstration thermometers and wind socks; and materials to support observations of habitats of organisms such as terrariums and aquariums; and

C1FC4340DFE701311BB868A86D17958E.description: Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student uses age-appropriate tools and models to investigate the natural world. The student is expected to:

C1FBF8B0DFE701311BB768A86D17958E.description: explore that scientists investigate different things in the natural world and use tools to help in their investigations.

C1FBB660DFE701311BB668A86D17958E.description: make predictions based on observable patterns in nature such as the shapes of leaves; and

C1FB72F0DFE701311BB568A86D17958E.description: identify and explain a problem such as the impact of littering on the playground and propose a solution in his/her own words;

C1FB3540DFE701311BB468A86D17958E.description: Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student knows that information and critical thinking are used in scientific problem solving. The student is expected to:

C1FAF8D0DFE701311BB368A86D17958E.description: communicate observations with others about simple descriptive investigations.

C1FAB880DFE701311BB268A86D17958E.description: record and organize data and observations using pictures, numbers, and words; and

C1FA7370DFE701311BB168A86D17958E.description: collect data and make observations using simple equipment such as hand lenses, primary balances, and non-standard measurement tools;

C1FA2470DFE701311BB068A86D17958E.description: plan and conduct simple descriptive investigations such as ways objects move;

C1F9E650DFE701311BAF68A86D17958E.description: ask questions about organisms, objects, and events observed in the natural world;

C1F9A710DFE701311BAE68A86D17958E.description: Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student develops abilities to ask questions and seek answers in classroom and outdoor investigations. The student is expected to:

C1F7FE40DFE701311BA868A86D17958E.description: demonstrate how to use, conserve, and dispose of natural resources and materials such as conserving water and reusing or recycling paper, plastic, and metal.

C1F7BE10DFE701311BA768A86D17958E.description: discuss the importance of safe practices to keep self and others safe and healthy; and

C1F760D0DFE701311BA668A86D17958E.description: identify and demonstrate safe practices as described in the Texas Safety Standards during classroom and outdoor investigations, including wearing safety goggles, washing hands, and using materials appropriately;

C1F70E60DFE701311BA568A86D17958E.description: Scientific investigation and reasoning. The student conducts classroom and outdoor investigations following home and school safety procedures and uses environmentally appropriate and responsible practices. The student is expected to:
